Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Rs-AFP1 (RsAFP1, Raphanus sativus-antigungal protein 1, natural AMPs; defensin; XXQ, UCSS1a; 4S=S, flowering seed plants)

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification: N-terminus is pyroglutamate.Activity: low salt medium A: active against A. brassicola (IC50 15 ug/ml), B. cinerea (IC50 8 ug/ml), F. culmorum (IC50 5 ug/ml), F. oxysporum f.sp. lycopersici (IC50 30 ug/ml), P. oryzae (IC50 0.3 ug/ml), and V. dahliae (IC50 5 ug/ml). Active against fungi A. brassicola (IC50 15 ug/ml), B. cinerea (IC50 8 ug/ml), and F. culmorum (IC50 5 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness: Activity of Rs-AFP1 to Rs-AFP3 reduced in the presence of metal ions. CaCl2-sensitive (1 mM CaCl2 + 50 mM KCl).Structure: Note that in the structure determined by NMR, the first residue of the peptide sequence is Glu rather than Gln.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.Updated 2/2014; 2/2023; 5/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Terras,F.R.G., Torrekens,S., van Leuven,F., Osborn,R.W., Vanderleyden,J., Cammue,B.P.A., Broekaert,W.F1993
Literature Information.Title: A new family of basic cysteine-rich plant antifungal proteins from Brassicaceae species.
